alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 20 at 3:35PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwester California, including much of western and central Los Angeles County. * WHEN...Until 630 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 328 PM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to heavy rain, with rainfall rates of one quarter to one half inch per hour. This will cause widespread ponding of water on area roadways and flooding of low lying areas and intersections. Between 0.3 and 0.6 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area through 630 PM PST. This additional rain will result in significant roadway flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Long Beach, eastern Malibu, Acton, Griffith Park, Universal City, Hollywood, Burbank, Downtown Los Angeles, North Hollywood, Beverly Hills, Pasadena, Glendale, Culver City, Alhambra, Inglewood, Van Nuys, Woodland Hills, Encino, Venice, Santa Monica, Torrance and Hawthorne. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
